intro: Mespilodaphne tristis var. obovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed mespilodaphne, is a rare and lesser-known species within the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its obovate leaves, which are typically glossy and have a distinct venation pattern. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in axillary inflorescences, followed by small, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a botanical curiosity and of interest for conservation efforts.
